title: Add screenshots throughout documentation
description: **As a** documentation reader **I want** screenshots and visual examples throughout the documentation **So that** I can see what features look like before using them **Context:** We have 20+ screenshots in docs/assets/screenshots/ but they're only used in a few places. Visual documentation significantly improves comprehension and engagement. **Available Screenshots** (docs/assets/screenshots/): - consoul-screenshot-start.png (244KB) - consoul-screenshot-conversation.png (504KB) - consoul-screenshot-conversation-with-tool-calls.png (387KB) - consoul-themes.gif (1.2MB - animated theme switching) - modal-*.png (9 modal screenshots) - theme-*.png (6 theme variations) **Reference Analysis (.local repos):** **AWS Copilot** - Heavy screenshot usage: - Command output examples - Architecture diagrams - Console screenshots - Before/after comparisons **Textual** (.local/textual/docs/images/): - Widget examples - Layout demonstrations - Theme showcases - Code output examples **Places Needing Screenshots:** 1. **Homepage** (docs/index.md): - Hero: consoul-screenshot-conversation.png - TUI card: theme-consoul-dark.png or consoul-themes.gif - CLI card: terminal output screenshot (need to create) - SDK card: code + result screenshot (need to create) 2. **Quick Start** (docs/quickstart.md): - TUI mode example - CLI chat example - First conversation screenshot 3. **User Guide - TUI** (docs/user-guide/tui/): - interface.md: Add layout screenshot with annotations - features.md: Feature-specific screenshots - keyboard-shortcuts.md: Quick reference visual - modals.md: All modal screenshots (already have 9!) - themes.md: All theme screenshots (already have 6!) 4. **CLI Chat** (docs/user-guide/cli-chat.md): - Basic session example - Slash command usage - Multi-turn conversation 5. **Features:** - Tool calling: modal-tool-call.png, modal-tool-manager.png - Image analysis: Example analysis screenshot - File editing: Before/after screenshots **Screenshots to Create:** 1. CLI chat basic session (terminal screenshot) 2. SDK usage example (code + output) 3. Code search in action 4. File editing workflow 5. Multi-model comparison **Technical Notes:** - glightbox already configured (mkdocs.yml:81-91) - Supports zoom, touch navigation, draggable - Use markdown image syntax: `![Alt text](path "Caption")` - For lightbox: `![Alt text](path){ .screenshot }` - Screenshot class from SOUL-176 CSS **Image Optimization:** - Current PNGs are large (200-500KB) - Consider WebP conversion for smaller sizes - Use responsive images: `srcset` for retina - Lazy loading for performance **Files to Modify:** - docs/index.md - Add hero screenshot - docs/quickstart.md - Add getting started screenshots - docs/user-guide/tui/*.md - Add all modal/theme screenshots - docs/user-guide/cli-chat.md - Add CLI session screenshots - docs/user-guide/code-search.md - Add search result screenshots - docs/user-guide/file-editing.md - Add editing workflow - docs/user-guide/image-analysis.md - Add analysis examples **Acceptance Criteria:** **Given** I visit the homepage **When** I view the hero section **Then** I see an engaging screenshot of Consoul in action **Given** I read TUI documentation **When** I view the modals page **Then** I see screenshots of all 9 modal types **Given** I read theme documentation **When** I scroll through **Then** I see all 6 theme variations with screenshots **Given** I click a screenshot **When** glightbox activates **Then** I see fullscreen zoomable image with caption **Given** I'm on mobile **When** viewing screenshots **Then** images scale appropriately and are tappable for fullscreen **Testing Considerations:** - Test glightbox on all screenshots - Verify image loading performance - Check responsive sizing on mobile - Ensure alt text for accessibility - Test lazy loading - Verify caption display **Implementation Hints:** 1. Use existing screenshots from docs/assets/screenshots/ 2. Add screenshot class for consistent styling 3. Write descriptive alt text and captions 4. Use glightbox for all large screenshots 5. Consider creating animated GIFs for workflows 6. Optimize images with WebP + PNG fallback 7. Add figure/figcaption for better semantics **Markdown Pattern:** ```markdown ``` **Story Points:** 5 **Labels:** documentation, task, visual, content **Dependencies:** - SOUL-176 (CSS) - For screenshot styling - SOUL-174 (Homepage) - Homepage needs screenshots **References:** - Existing: docs/assets/screenshots/ (20+ files) - .local/textual/docs/images/ (widget examples) - glightbox docs for advanced features
